title: Virtual World-Based Science Inquiry Assessment Design and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific inquiry methods and basic experience with virtual environment interfaces
context.additional_context: Course focused on designing science inquiry assessments requiring socioscientific approaches. Learns virtual world design strategies to reduce cognitive load and improve assessment efficiency for 20-something learners (students/job seekers).

learning_goals: Learners can apply visual signaling systems (e.g., highlighting interactive objects) when designing virtual world-based assessment tools.
Learners can analyze cognitive load measurement metrics in game-based assessments and interpret the results.
Learners can develop assessment scenarios reflecting socioscientific inquiry processes in 3D virtual environments.

resources: Virtual world creation templates (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition, Unity3D sample projects)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
